definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: You meet someone you hate and you get angry.
sentences.chinese: 你遇到了你讨厌的人时你会发怒。

sentences.english: The woman bristled when I asked her to move.
sentences.chinese: 当我叫那女人往前挪动时，她发怒了。

sentences.english: Though never rebellious, he sometimes bristled at being given too many directions.
sentences.chinese: 虽然从不叛逆，但有时，他会对过多的命令发怒。

sentences.english: Uzziah, who had a censer in his hand ready to burn incense, became angry.
sentences.chinese: 乌西雅就发怒，手拿香炉要烧香。

sentences.english: This kind of person is incontrollable oneself feeling, often be angry grouch.
sentences.chinese: 这种人不能控制自己的感情，常发怒闹脾气。

sentences.english: And the anger of the LORD was kindled against them; and he departed.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华就向他们二人发怒而去。

sentences.english: Nobody knows why my father has been spunky lately.
sentences.chinese: 谁也不知道我爸爸近来为什么容易发怒。

sentences.english: Hard-to-readfonts are a fast way to get your resume on the bottom of any HRmanager’s stack.
sentences.chinese: 简历上难读的字体是最容易让人事经理发怒的一件事。

sentences.english: but people are shorter-tempered, but just seem more irritable
sentences.chinese: 但是人们脾气更暴躁，更容易发怒。

sentences.english: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.
sentences.chinese: 并将他的百姓交与刀剑，向他的产业发怒。

sentences.english: When my father sees the dent in his fender, he'll be mad as hornet.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲看到汽车挡泥板上的凹痕时，他一定会发怒的。

sentences.english: Even when she was angry, she observed the proprieties.
sentences.chinese: 甚至当她发怒的时候，都要遵从礼节。

sentences.english: You just hate waste, and when someone else costs you dearly you see red.
sentences.chinese: 你厌恶浪费，如果别人让你大肆破费，你会发怒。

sentences.english: Angry LeiSong Warsaw pact mu-lan jiang to drink, because the last thing to her apology.
sentences.chinese: 雷颂华约江木兰喝酒，因为上次发怒的事情给她道歉。

sentences.english: In the current U.S.-China feud, both sides have ample grounds to get their dander up.
sentences.chinese: 在目前的美中纠纷中，双方都有足够的理由发怒。

sentences.english: And I was very angry when I heard their cry and these words.
sentences.chinese: 我听见他们呼号说这些话，便甚发怒。

definition: to fly into a rage/to rage violently
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to flip out/to act out violently
lit. hair stands up in anger and tips off one's hat (idiom)/fig. seething in anger/raise one's hackles
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
